title: 820-2879 green light, fan can spin
message:
when i short on off, fan can spin, but no chime, and will cycle every 10 second, stop, spin, stop spin
ppbus 12.56v
pp3v42 : 3.42v
resistance of pp3v42 to ground is 2.5k ohm, i heard if its below 30k , its considered a bad mcp?
i tried to do smc bypass, but only the fan spin at maximum speed, but still no chime or anything indicating its alive
ppvcore_s0_cpu cycling from 3v to 1v

title: 820-2879 green light, fan can spin
message:
Looks like bad MCP.
Allow 20s after power removed and check again resistance to ground at 3V42 line.

Does the board stays on without RAM?
Did you try DDR3-8500?

3V pulse at VCORE is very strange...

title: 820-2879 green light, fan can spin
message:
okay, after letting it rest for awhile, resistance to ground pp3v42 is 9 kohm,,
board still cycle without any ram, ocassionally will have maximum fan speed, no chime
i already used 8500s ram..

somewhere arounbd 2.5-3.4v of vcore but its actually too fast to catch a glimpse, as it lower to 1v after fan spin

title: 820-2879 green light, fan can spin
message: Bad MCP, don't waste more time on it...
